p: Climate change increases in the severity of extreme weather events, declining air quality, and destabilizing natural systems due to the increase of greenhouse gas emissions. The direct and indirect health results of such a global imbalance include excessive heat-related illnesses, increased vector- and waterborne diseases, increased exposure to environmental toxins, exacerbation of cardiovascular and respiratory diseases due to declining air quality, and mental health stress among others ( Luber and Prudent, 2009).
